name: Survival
effect: +1 Happiness, Science, Gold, and Culture in capital. +1 Production and +1 Food in all cities.

policies.name: Unification
policies.effect: 25% less unhappiness from population. Purchase cost in cities reduced by 25%.
uniques: Cost of purchasing items in cities reduced by [25]%

policies.name: Propogation
policies.effect: All cities have +25% growth, and the capital has an additional +25% growth.

policies.name: Optimization
policies.effect: Cities have +25% production when they are constructing Buildings.

policies.name: Adaptation
policies.effect: Production to science conversion rates increased by 33%. All cities give +1 science per 2 population they have.

policies.name: Actualization
policies.effect: +5 Culture in the capital and +10% Culture in all cities. Free social policy.

policies.name: Survival Complete
policies.effect: +2 of every stat (Happiness, Science, Food, Culture, Gold, Production, etc.) in all cities.
uniques: [+2 Happiness, +2 Science, +2 Gold, +2 Culture, +2 Production, +2 Food] [in all cities]

name: Growth
effect: +15% growth in all cities. +1 food per 2 population in all cities

policies.name: Collective Living
policies.effect: 50% less unhappiness from population, +1 happiness for every 4 citizens in a city

policies.name: Synaptic Expansion
policies.effect: Immediately creates a cheapest available cultural building in each of your first 4 cities for free. Gain a free policy.
uniques: Immediately creates a cheapest available cultural building in each of your first [4] cities for free

policies.name: Enforcement Instincts
policies.effect: Units in cities cost no Maintenance, garrisoned cities have +50% attacking strength and +3 Happiness.
uniques: Units in cities cost no Maintenance
+[50]% attacking strength for cities with garrisoned units
[+3 Happiness] [in all cities with a garrison]

policies.name: Reflexive Designs
policies.effect: +25% production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital and +5 production in capital
uniques: +25% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital

policies.name: Delegated Autonomy
policies.effect: +2 Culture and +2 Happiness from every specialist. Specialists consume half as much food. Starts a golden age.

policies.name: Growth Complete
policies.effect: +15% growth and +2 food in all cities. Free Great Unit.

name: Adaptability
effect: 50% reduced cost when purchasing (with gold) and aquiring (with culture) tiles.
uniques: -[50]% Culture cost of acquiring tiles [in all cities]

policies.name: Expansion Instincts
policies.effect: Training of Spawning Drones increased +50% in capital, receive a new Spawning Drone near the capital
uniques: +[50]% Production when constructing [Spawning Drone] units [in capital]

policies.name: Habitat Manipulation
policies.effect: Tile improvement speed +25%, receive a free worker near the capital

policies.name: Expanded Ephapse
policies.effect: Each city founded increases culture cost of policies 50% less than normal. Golden Age length increased by 25%.
uniques: Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [50]% less than normal

policies.name: Environmental Mastery
policies.effect: +1 production from every strategic resource. Tile yields from Natural Wonders doubled.
uniques: Tile yields from Natural Wonders doubled

policies.name: Subspace Consciousness
policies.effect: +5 production and culture in every city connected to capital, Tile yield from Great Improvements doubled. Starts a golden age.
uniques: [+5 Production, +5 Culture] [in all cities connected to capital]

policies.name: Adaptability Complete
policies.effect: +2 Production in all cities. Golden Age length increased by 15%. Free worker drones and spawning drones appear near capital immediately (3 of each).

name: Predation
effect: +25% bonus vs Barbarians; gain Culture when you kill a barbarian unit. Notified of new Barbarian encampments.
uniques: Earn [100]% of [Barbarian] opponent's [Cost] as [Culture] for kills

policies.name: Innate Aggression
policies.effect: -33% unit upkeep and purchase (with gold) costs. Wounded units deal double damage.

policies.name: Swarming Instincts
policies.effect: +30% combat strength for melee units with adjacent military allies. +50% production when training melee units.
uniques: [+30]% Strength for [Melee] units which have another [Military] unit in an adjacent tile

policies.name: Warbred
policies.effect: Military units gain double experience from combat. New military units start with [15] Experience.
uniques: [Military] units gain [100]% more Experience from combat
New military units start with [15] Experience

policies.name: Survival Of The Fittest
policies.effect: +30% Strength when fighting City-State units and cities. Receive triple Gold from Barbarian encampments and pillaging Cities. Upon capturing a city, gain a huge amount of culture (relative to it's culture production) instantly.
uniques: +30% Strength when fighting City-State units and cities
Upon capturing a city, receive [10] times its [Culture] production as [Culture] immediately

uniques.name: Assimilation
uniques.effect: For each Military unit killed, gain culture based on its strength and gold based on its cost. Starts a golden age.

uniques.name: Predation Complete
uniques.effect: +2 Happiness in all cities. +15% production towards military units. +250% attack bonus to all Military Units for 5 turns
uniques: +[250]% attack strength to all [Military] units for [5] turns

policies.name: Introspection
policies.effect: Culture cost of future policies reduced by 10%. Building time and purchase cost of culture buildings reduced by 25%. Building time of Wonders reduced by 25%.
uniques: Cost of purchasing [Culture] buildings reduced by [25]%
Culture cost of adopting new Policies reduced by [10]%

policies.name: Hive Sentience
policies.effect: Culture cost of future policies reduced by 25%. Free social policy.
uniques: Culture cost of adopting new Policies reduced by [25]%

policies.name: Compliance Insticts
policies.effect: 50% of excess happiness added to culture towards policies. Specialists produce half as much unhappiness. +3 Happiness in all cities.
uniques: 50% of excess happiness added to culture towards policies
Specialists only produce [50]% of normal unhappiness

policies.name: Psionic Identity
policies.effect: Double culture in all cities with a world wonder. +5 Culture from every wonder.
uniques: +[100]% [Culture] [in all cities with a world wonder]

policies.name: Synaptic Web
policies.effect: +5 Happiness and +5 Culture in captial and every city connected to it.
uniques: [+5 Happiness, +5 Culture] [in all cities connected to capital]

policies.name: Ascension Complex
policies.effect: +33% gold, culture, and science in all cities with a world wonder. +1 Movement and +10% Strength for units during golden ages. Starts a golden age.
uniques: +[33]% [Gold] [in all cities with a world wonder]
+[33]% [Culture] [in all cities with a world wonder]
+[33]% [Science] [in all cities with a world wonder]
+1 Movement for all units during Golden Age
+10% Strength for all units during Golden Age

policies.name: Introspection Complete
policies.effect: +2 Culture in all cities. Gain a free policy. Culture cost of future policies reduced by 15%.
uniques: Culture cost of adopting new Policies reduced by [15]%

policies.name: Evolution
policies.effect: Gain +25% science production while the empire is happy. Gain +10% science production in all cities, and an additional +15% science production in capital.
uniques: Production to science conversion in cities increased by 33%

policies.name: Synaptic Burst
policies.effect: Grants a Free Technology. Gain a free Social Policy.

policies.name: Progressive Designs
policies.effect: +2 science from every culture building. Psionic Node, Psionic Nexus, and Psionic Monolith provide an additional +1 Science as well.

policies.name: Memnonic Absorbtion
policies.effect: +3 science from every Harvesting Grounds. When killing a unit, gain 25% of its cost as Science instantly.

policies.name: Autonomous Creativity
policies.effect: Gain +75% science production while empire is happy, but lose 25% science production at all times.

policies.name: Mental Osmosis
policies.effect: Science gained from research agreements +50%. +1 Science per 2 population in all cities

policies.name: Evolution Complete
policies.effect: Gain 2 free Technologies. +15% science in all cities. Also gain an additional +2 science in all cities.

policies.name: Prosperity
policies.effect: Gain +25% gold production while the empire is happy. +2 Gold from all gold buildings. +1 Happiness from each type of luxury resource.
uniques: +[1] happiness from each type of luxury resource

policies.name: Resource Pacts
policies.effect: +3 Gold in all cities connected to the capital and from each trade route.
uniques: [+3 Production] [in all cities connected to capital]

policies.name: Shared Possessions
policies.effect: Cost of purchasing items in cities reduced by 25%. Gold cost of purchasing units reduced by an additional 25% as well. Gain +1 gold per population in all cities.
uniques: Cost of purchasing items in cities reduced by [25]%

policies.name: Trade Drones
policies.effect: Great Merchants are earned 25% faster, +3 Gold and +2 Science from each trade route. Earn double gold from trade missions (such as those performed by Great Scions).
uniques: [+3 Gold, +2 Science] from each Trade Route
Double gold from Great Merchant trade missions

policies.name: Communal Labor
policies.effect: Cost of purchasing culture buildings reduced by 50%
uniques: Cost of purchasing [Culture] buildings reduced by [50]%

policies.name: Hive Beneficence
policies.effect: Up to 10 owned units cost no maintenance. Half maintenance cost for buildings (in all cities).
uniques: -[50]% maintenance cost for buildings [in all cities]

policies.name: Prosperity Complete
policies.effect: Creates a Great Vault in each of your first five cities (does not trigger for later built cities if you have less than five on completion). Gain +15% gold production while the empire is happy. +10% Gold in all cities.  Also gain an additional +2 gold in all cities.
uniques: Immediately creates a [Great Vault] in each of your first [5] cities for free

policies.name: Symbiosis
uniques: [+1 Gold, +1 Science, +1 Culture, +1 Happiness, +1 Faith] from each Trade Route
Happiness from Luxury Resources gifted by City-States increased by [100]%

policies.name: Altruism
policies.effect: Gifts of Gold to City-States generate double Influence. Gain 100 Influence when gifting Great People to city-states. Free Social Policy.
uniques: Gifts of Gold to City-States generate [100]% more Influence
Gain [100] Influence with a [Great Person] gift to a City-State

policies.name: Bonded Minds
uniques: Resting point for Influence with City-States is increased by [50]
City-State Influence recovers at twice the normal rate

policies.name: Mimicry
uniques: Allied City-States provide Science equal to [50]% of what they produce for themselves

policies.name: Mutualism
uniques: Quantity of Resources gifted by City-States increased by [100]%
Allied City-States will occasionally gift Great People

policies.name: United Strength
uniques: Food and Culture from Friendly City-States are increased by 50%
Militaristic City-States grant units [5] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
+5% Production for every Trade Route with a City-State in the empire
policies.uniques: Militaristic City-States grant units twice as often when you are at war with a common foe

policies.name: Symbiosis Complete
policies.effect: +2 Gold, Science, Culture, and Happiness from each Trade Route. Two free Great Scion units appear. City-State Influence degrades 15% slower.
uniques: [+2 Gold, +2 Science, +2 Culture, +2 Happiness] from each Trade Route

uniques: [+2 Happiness, +2 Science, +2 Gold, +2 Culture, +2 Production, +2 Food] [in all cities]

uniques: Culture cost of adopting new Policies reduced by [15]%

policies.effect: Creates a Great Vault in each of your first five cities (does not trigger for later built cities if you have less than five on completion). Gain +15% gold production while the empire is happy. +10% Gold in all cities.  Also gain an additional +2 gold in all cities.

policies.name: Mastery of Symbiosis
policies.effect: +2 Gold, Science, Culture, and Happiness from each Trade Route. Two free Great Scion units appear. City-State Influence degrades 15% slower.

policies.name: Utopia Complete
